WorkItem.Description: When an item which is expanded and has selected child nodes, but is unselected itself, is collapsed, it is automatically selected. I haven't found the cause yet because I don't know where the expander button is actually located and what it does.
WorkItem.Summary: Collapsing an item with selected children selects the item

Comments.Message:
Update: The collapsed node isn't really selected, it's just displayed like selected. You can verify when expanding the node again and then Ctrl+selecting another node. then the now again expanded node is no longer displayed as selected. The commented debug log line in the setter of IsSelected has indicated that.

The recent fix for issue 23068 (changeset 68107) doesn't seem to be responsible for that.

Alright, the collapsed item is not selected, it really is focused. It just looks the same. The focus wanders unexpectedly in some other situations as well, so I'm going to change the focus style as it's really unrecognisable.

I can not reproduce this behaviour. This is what I've done:

1. Start the BindingSample
2. Expand element1 and element13
3. Select element 131
4. Close element13
5. Ctrl select element 15
->As you can see, element 13 is not selected, it was just focused
6. Expand element 13
->As you can see, element131 is still selected

Everything like it should be, dont you think? :-)

As I said, the focus in the original code looks the same as a selection. This has confused me first. After changing the focus appearance to something else, the difference is obvious and the display bug no longer present.
